name: Hotel Porta Felice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were fantastic, most notably Rjo, Alexandra, Paolo and Fabrizio. We didn't use the spa, but the small roof terrace was nice for relaxing, breakfast was average. There was free wi-fi, but we could only get it on the roof terrace, not in the room. The bed mattress was the hardest we have ever experienced, very uncomfortable! No tea/coffee making facilities in the room, and none available after midnight anywhere in the hotel. Good location for walking to nearby attractions. We booked a week in Palermo, but would suggest 3 day stay is enough to see the city.
reviews.title: Generally a nice hotel, but not as good as we'd hoped!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we booked our 4 night stay at Hotel Porta Felice based on the excellent reviews on TA. We were deeply disappointed. Upon our arrival, we were informed that we had to stay our first night at a nearby hotel due to an unexpected incident which made rooms on the 2nd floor not available. Subsequently we found out that we were bumped out in order to accommodate a large tour group. The reception person expressed hotel's desire to compensate for our inconvenience, but declined to offer us the complimentary massage we requested. We expressed displeasure, but the manager never responded to our complaints during the time we stayed at the hotel. The room is large with functional AC and a comfy bed. The bathroom has good shower with plenty of hot water. However, the hotel facility is not up to the standards of a 4 star. During the 3 nights we stayed, one elevator was under repair and the other was malfunctioning. Fortunately we were able to get out of the elevator unharmed. Breakfast was poor, with very limited and basic selection of choices and served in a rather shabby and cramped space. Very slow wifi. Staff at reception was helpful.
reviews.title: Convenient location, but not special

reviews.text: We took two double rooms for 3 nights. Helpful staff. Pleasant place for breakfast on the last floor. Nice choice for breakfast, fresh food. Very comfortable beds. Clean, quite spacious rooms. Bathroom with bidet. I would chose exactly same hotel if I go second time :)
reviews.title: great, comfortable stay in Palermo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is small and friendly. The staff are nice and helpful.
reviews.title: very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is great and you can walk anywhere. We had a car and it was easy to find parking in the area. You can manage with a car in Palermo even though some say you can't.
reviews.title: Superb hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We started our May 2013 Sicily trip in Palermo. This hotel was perfect for our needs. Our deluxe room had a very comfortable bed, pillows, soft sheets, big bathroom, high ceilings.....and most important, it was quiet, none of the hustle bustle of downtown Palermo, but close enough to walk to the main streets, shopping. Great staff. Super massage/spa, which we had after the long flight from california. I would stay again.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great 1 night stay at this hotel. It's conveniently located right at the edge of the centre of Palermo, and yet there was plenty of free parking where we could leave our car. The hotel looks really new, it's sleek and clean, and the same can be said for the room which was quite spacious and comfortable. The wardrobe was probably the largest I have seen in a hotel of this range, and the toilet was great too, with a nice powerful shower.
reviews.title: Comfortable and sleek, in a great central location
Helpful Staff
reviews.text: We drove from the Palermo Airport to the hotel and, with some help from GPS, had little difficulty in locating Porta Felice. They offer street parking, but, we opted to pay for parking. Room was spacious and modern, with WiFi, though, this worked better in the restaurant. It took some getting used to their security and energy saving system, but, only a small annoyance. Breakfast was standard fare and dinner was very good. Room views from the back of the hotel are non-existent. Noise from cats and birds forced us to keep the windows closed and run the A/C; even then, they can wake you at night. Staff was very helpful and, in particular, Alessandra, who tried to help us locate the birth certificate for my wife's grandfather (born near Palermo). She seemed to take it as a personal challenge, but, unfortunately, we hit a wall without an actual day and month. We were also impressed at her ability to continue helping others, while waiting for assistance on the phone to the Office of Records. Hotel location is very accessible to all sites and restaurants, so, we never used the car until we left for Catania. Enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend to others.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel in a good location for the night life. The rooms are good and the restaurant has nice food and a good view. Don't bother with the bar, its just the restaurant and it closes early. We had a room facing onto the street but there was no problem with noise as the windows are well insulated. Would go back again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We looked for a boutique hotel style and this got it. Stayed for 3 nights. Rooms were very nicely done, nothing bad to say at all. Breakfast was very good, as one can expect in Italy, warm cakes etc, and everything else in a very nice breakfast area on the top floor. Location of the hotel was very good, not far from the centre, not far from the seaside. Staff were very good with the exception of the luggage boy who showed us the room, saw our key card didn't work, used his and did not make an attempt to correct it (change it). Didn't bother to complain but these are details that good staff should look at. Bit noisy at the backside, still don't know if were seagulls or cats in love but nothing the hotel could have avoided. We asked for a room change which was granted.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good rooms, good location

reviews.text: While this hotel is well located and the rooms a good size I was disappointed in it overall. The mood lighting made it very difficult to read, we had the smell of drains in the bathroom which permeated the room, there was no drinking water provided and the shower pressure was terrible. Breakfast had a good array of cakes but the service, coffee and range wasn't good.
reviews.title: Not as good as expected

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Porta Felice. It is around a 20 minute walk from the centre but only 5 mins from the seafront. The best way to get to the hotel from the airport is on the Prestia a Commande bus to the Stazione Centrale at €11 return and then you can either walk (about 20 mins) or taxi for around €15 to the hotel. The reception staff were incredibly helpful and spoke good English. We were quite surprised that not many people spoke English in Palermo.
reviews.title: Lovely cool room with modern decor

reviews.text: Our room was spacious with lovely decor and the air conditioning worked wonderfully as it was so humid outside.
reviews.title: So close to Vuccaria market, bars and cafes

reviews.text: We had a room on the first floor at the side of the hotel so it was nice and quiet. Don't expect a great view though as it's on a very narrow street, this didn't bother us though. The bathroom was a little dated but was fine for a long weekend.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: Breakfast was pretty poor, a mere selection of cakes, bread and cereal and some sorry looking bacon and eggs. The staff were not particularly good at keeping the small selection topped up.
reviews.title: 4 nights in Palermo

reviews.text: As part of a coach trip you don't expect marvels but we found our room at the back of the hotel perfectly comfortable and pleasant. It was spotlessly clean and the beds were comfortable. We didn't manage to get the aircon working by ourselves but got help which was friendly and prompt. We were not bothered by the lack of a view or of coffee-making equipment, though to have these would have been a bonus. The breakfast terrace is pleasant and the fare was entirely satisfactory without being extra special. The free wifi worked perfectly for us. We thought the situation was fine, and would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel while adding that there may be other hotels that are even more exciting in Palermo.
reviews.title: We stayed here for two nights at the start of our Sicily week and one at the end.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful peacful small hotel with good and friendly service.
reviews.title: A lovely retreat in Palermo.

reviews.text: Rooftop garden restaurant with a wieu is nice for breakfast as well as an evening meal.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there for almost a week, reasonably priced and would gladly come back. :)
reviews.title: Clean modern, quiet & great pillows

reviews.text: My wife and I were somewhat disappointed particularly as this hotel had received good feedback and a 5 star rating. It was pleasant, clean with very helpful reception staff. The room we stayed in had a bad smell, which I think was from the air conditioning unit. It certainly was looking tired as the paint was peeling off the walls. Our room was at the back and quiet. The breakfast was a big disappointment, I have travelled extensively throughout the world and this was not any breakfast to write home about.
reviews.title: Nice modern design w comfort

description: Situated in the heart of Palermo, in the historical city centre, a few metres from Foro Italico gardens, Piazza Marina, via Alloro and Corso Vittorio Emanuele.It is elegant and welcoming. It was built on the foundations of a XVIII century building and has been completely reconstructed. There are 30 rooms and 3 suites all equipped with satellite tv, internet connection, telephone, safe and mini bar.Breakfast and bar services are located on the top floor on a panoramic terrace from where it is possible to admire the walls of Palazzo Steri and Piazza Marina. The Wellness club, on the ground floor, offers a wide range of relaxing services from a sauna, steam bath, small pool with hydro massage, emotional showers and also many personalized beauty treatments and massages.For meetings there are 2 rooms up to 20 persons and also, on request, there is a guarded parking area nearby.
